choices.text:
write a python function to read from an excel spreadsheet.
import openpyxl
def read_excel(file): 
    # Load the workbook
    wb = openpyxl.load_workbook(file)  
    
    # Get the worksheet dimension
    sheet_dimensions = wb.sheetnames() 
      
    for i in range(len(sheet_dimensions)): 
        print("Sheet {0} is not available".format(sheet_dimensions[i])) 
          
    # Iterate through each worksheet and print the first row of data
    for sheet_num, sheet in wb.iteritems():  
        print("\nReading Data from Sheet {0}".format(str(sheet_num)))     
           
        # Get the dimensions of the worksheet
        ws_dimensions = sheet.rows[0].range.index 
          
        for i in range(ws_dimensions):  
             
            print("Row {0}, Column {1} is not available".format(i+1, i+1))   
              
        # Iterate through each row and column to get the data from the worksheet 
        for row_num in range(ws_dimensions):  
            
            print("\nReading Data from Row {0}".format(row_num + 1))     
               
            for col_num in range(len(sheet.rows[row_num].cells)):   
                    
                # Get the value of each cell and print it to console  
                val = sheet.rows[row_num].cells[col_num].value 
                print("{0}, {1} is not available".format(str(val), str(sheet.rows[row_num].cells[col_num].address))   
                     
        # Save the workbook to a file
        wb.save(file)
